avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier on shady slopes above 2000m, mostly medium-sized releases. Due to daytime warming and solar radiaation, moist loose-snow avalanches are possible, mostly small releases on very steep sunny slopes. On very steep grass-covered slopes glide-snow avalanches are possible, mostly small sized releases, esp. on very steep sunny slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: weak layers in old snow are main danger

snowpackStructure.comment: Clear skies widespread. Due to low temperatures and low air moisture, near-surface crusts form above 2000m. In the lowermost part of the snopwpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident.

tendency.highlights: Beware weak layers in old snow

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, superb weather will continue, cloudless skies, outstanding visibility. Light winds, temperatures rising. At 1000m: +9 degrees; at 2000m: 0 degrees. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier on shady slopes above 2000m, mostly medium-sized releases. Freshly generated snowdrift accumulations can be triggered by one sole skier, esp. on shady slopes. Caution urged at the foot of rock walls and behind protruberances in the terrain, and in gullies and bowls. Due to daytime warming and solar radiaation, moist loose-snow avalanches are possible, mostly small releases on very steep sunny slopes. On very steep grass-covered slopes glide-snow avalanches are possible, also medium sized releases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution:  weak layers in the old snow

snowpackStructure.comment: Clear skies widespread. Due to low temperatures and low air moisture, near-surface crusts form above 2400m. In the lowermost part of the snopwpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. above 2000m. Fresh snowdrift accumulations are being deposited atop soft layers above 2400m.

tendency.highlights: Caution: weak layers in the old snow

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, superb weather will continue, cloudless skies, outstanding visibility. Light winds, temperatures rising. At 1000m: +9 degrees; at 2000m: 0 degrees; at 3000m: -4 degrees. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier on shady slopes above 2000m, mostly medium-sized releases. Due to daytime warming and solar radiaation, moist loose-snow avalanches are possible, mostly small releases on very steep sunny slopes. On very steep grass-covered slopes glide-snow avalanches are possible, mostly small sized releases, esp. on very steep sunny slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated danger zones. Wet loose-snow avalanches possible on very steep sunny slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment: Clear skies widespread. Due to low temperatures and low air moisture, near-surface crusts form above 2400m. In the lowermost part of the snopwpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. above 2000m. Fresh snowdrift accumulations are being deposited atop soft layers.

Freshly generated snowdrift accumulations can be triggered by one sole skier, esp. on shady slopes. Caution urged at the foot of rock walls and behind protruberances in the terrain, and in gullies and bowls. Due to daytime warming and solar radiaation, moist loose-snow avalanches are possible, mostly small releases on very steep sunny slopes. On very steep grass-covered slopes glide-snow avalanches are possible, also medium sized releases.
